name: Harbor access.txt - Production Harbor
description: This section provides information about the Production Harbor, which is a web-based user interface for managing container images and related resources. It is hosted on the ops-common cluster and can be accessed via the provided URL (https://harbor.razorpay.com/). The section also mentions that users have guest-level access by default, and if they need additional permissions, they need to raise a ticket with the IT department. Additionally, it provides a link to the Harbor documentation for understanding user roles and permissions.
use_cases: Accessing the Production Harbor web interface
Understanding user roles and permissions in Harbor
Requesting additional permissions or roles for Harbor access

name: Harbor access.txt - Wallet Harbor
description: This section appears to outline different types of access or permissions related to a Harbor, which could be a software platform or system. The two items listed, 'Harbor-Guest' and 'Harbor-developer', suggest different levels of access or roles within the Harbor system. A 'Guest' role likely has limited access or privileges, while a 'developer' role may have more extensive permissions for development or modification purposes.
use_cases: Granting limited or guest-level access to a Harbor system
Providing developer-level access for building or modifying the Harbor system
Managing user roles and permissions within the Harbor system
Controlling access to sensitive or restricted areas of the Harbor system

name: Harbor access.txt - Stage Harbor
description: This section provides information about Harbor, which seems to be a platform or service related to access management. It explains the different environments or instances of Harbor, such as the production environment (Harbor-projectAdmin) running on the prod-wallet-white cluster, and the stage environment (Stage Harbor) running on the stage-white-eks cluster. Each environment has a specific endpoint URL for accessing it. The section also mentions different user roles or access levels, such as Harbor-admin, Harbor-Guest, Harbor-user, and Harbor-projectAdmin.
use_cases: Accessing the production Harbor instance (Harbor-projectAdmin) for wallet-related operations
Accessing the stage Harbor instance (Stage Harbor) for testing or development purposes
Managing user access and roles within Harbor (Harbor-admin, Harbor-Guest, Harbor-user, Harbor-projectAdmin)
capabilities: Harbor instances for different environments (production, stage)
Endpoint URLs for accessing Harbor instances
User roles or access levels (Harbor-admin, Harbor-Guest, Harbor-user, Harbor-projectAdmin)
Cluster and namespace information (prod-wallet-white cluster, stage-white-eks cluster, harbor namespace)
